Package decks

Class Deck

java.lang.Object
decks.Deck
Direct Known Subclasses:
ActionCardDeck, BlueCardDeck, CareerCardDeck, HouseCardDeck, SalaryCardDeck
public abstract class Deck
extends java.lang.Object
Abstract class providing a skeletal implementation of a deck

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Deck​(java.lang.String name, int initNumCards)
    Constructor with the specified name and the initial number of cards in this deck as parameters The method for shuffling the generated cards is also called in this constructor; therefore, the cards are guaranteed to be shuffled every time an object of a specific subclass of Deck is created.

    Returns the number of cards in this deck initially

    Returns true if this deck is empty; false, otherwise

    Returns the card to be removed from the deck given its specified index

  • Constructor Details

    • Deck

      public Deck​(java.lang.String name, int initNumCards)
      Constructor with the specified name and the initial number of cards in this deck as parameters The method for shuffling the generated cards is also called in this constructor; therefore, the cards are guaranteed to be shuffled every time an object of a specific subclass of Deck is created.
      Parameters:
      name - name of this deck
      initNumCards - number of cards in the deck initially

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Return the name of this deck

      The name is the most specific identifier of the deck.

      Returns:
      name of this deck

    • setCards

      public void setCards​(java.util.ArrayList<Card> cards)
      Sets the cards in this deck to the cards in the given ArrayList
      Parameters:
      cards - is the given ArrayList of cards to which the cards in this deck will be set

    • generate

      public abstract java.util.ArrayList<Card> generate()
      Abstract method for returning the initial (unshuffled) set of cards to be stored inside this deck

      Once this method is called inside the constructor to generate the initial set of cards, re-calling this method will simply return a set of cards but will not affect the cards inside the deck.

      Returns:
      initial (unshuffled) set of cards to be stored inside this deck

    • pop

      public Card pop()
      Removes and returns the topmost card inside this deck (that is, the card drawn by the player)

      More formally, it discards and returns the last element of the ArrayList containing the cards (similar to the pop operation in a stack data structure). If this deck is empty, then null is returned.

      Returns:
      topmost card that is drawn by the player and removed from this deck; null if this deck is empty

    • top

      public Card top()
      Returns the topmost card inside this deck
      Returns:
      topmost card of this deck

    • pick

      public Card pick​(int index)
      Returns the card to be removed from the deck given its specified index
      Parameters:
      index - of the card to be picked
      Returns:
      card at the chosen index inside this deck

    • returnCard

      public void returnCard​(Card c)
      Transfers a given card back into the deck
      Parameters:
      c - card to be returned

    • returnCardToBottom

      public void returnCardToBottom​(Card c)
      Transfers a given card into the bottom of the deck where it was drawn
      Parameters:
      c - card to be returned

    • shuffle

      public void shuffle()
      Shuffles the cards inside this deck

      More formally, it permutes the order of the cards inside this deck using a method in the Java utility class Collections.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if this deck is empty; false, otherwise
      Returns:
      true if this deck is empty; false, otherwise

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this deck, which includes its name, the number of cards initially and currently inside it, and the string representations of the cards currently inside it

      In particular, the representation contains the following details:

      • Name of this deck
      • Number of cards initially inside it
      • Number of cards currently inside it
      • String representations of the cards currently inside it (the first card displayed is the topmost)
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      string representation of this deck, which includes its name, the number of cards initially and currently inside it, and the string representations of the cards currently inside it
